Similar to Rocket League, there is a lot of in game purchases, but it can be a lot of fun without spending a single extra dollar. It's the kind of game you play for a bit and come back to once in a while.

Some matches are tense and memorable, while some the killer will just be standing around doing nothing swinging his weapon. (I assume people do this to farm xp??) So your experience will be hit and miss, but when it does hit, it's a lot of fun.

I'd like to start by saying, as it stands in it's current form in Dec 2020, Dead by Daylight is an unbalanced game that favours the survivor class over the killer class.

I've played against plenty of entitled survivors rage quitting because the game isn't going their way. I have never once experienced a killer rage quitting. I'm sure it happens but it hasn't to me. The amount of BS killers go through compared to survivors is unreal. Entire parties Tee bagging on the finishing line, lobbies of friends all communicating and running meta to **** all over the killers day, body blocking and the aforementioned disconnecting are only some of the **** killers get to deal with dozens of times a night. 
What have survivors got to be upset about? Sucking and getting killed. Blood warden is always a brutal turn when it works too but its situational and fair.
Yeah its tough on both sides. Wanna win as the killer? Play like a god or pull a pink skull out of your ***. Wanna win as a survivor? Run dead hard, decisive strike, unbreakable and borrowed time and win without trying. But no one will be impressed when you do.
Dead hard, decisive strike, unbreakable and borrowed time are the meta perks for survivors. Most survivors run them or are actively specking towards them, and they come in handy EVERY MATCH without exception. They are broken, nerf them.

This game has limitless potential and I will keep playing since I already own the game but I would not recommend the reader joining me and buying the game. Not until the developers try playing a couple rounds at high rank as the killer so they can see how truly broken their game and community actually are.

This game has shown and put me through things worse then death

My masochism allows me to love being chased, hooked and tunnelled and stepped on by Daddy Blight, though I'll still run away screaming to give Daddy Blight the thrill of the hunt before I scare it off by turning around blushing and saying "owo Daddy Blight please step on me hard."

Being serious when playing as survivor the best experience is when playing with friends because when you solo queue it makes it more likely you'll get people who lead the killer straight to you (most of the time by accident as no coms, but sometimes they do it on purpose to troll or to try to get the killer off of them) which is a pain in the ass if you're trying to not 3 gen the team and trying to get a certain generator done to stop that from happening. So if you have 3 more people to play with I recommend playing survivor games with them for optimal communication if you're looking to win matches, though it's also fun to just â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ around with friends and meme around, a 4th friend to have 5 people for customs is also really fun because customs allows you to try out all the perks the game has to offer so it's fun to play around with those in customs with friends.

Now if you're on your own I do recommend playing killer more frequently than survivor (unless if you're a masochist like me... uh well, sometimes you need to be a masochist to play as killer too haha) as you don't have a team you need to worry about. Your goal is to apply pressure on the generators, down and hook survivors (don't tunnel though otherwise you're asking for decisive strike to plough you down into the earth, as well as other anti tunnelling perks that'll make your life hell if survivors have half a mind to run them lmao, and tunnelling is usually seen as a toxic behaviour so unless you want to be flamed in after match chat don't do it lol) to sacrifice to the entity. You get points for damaging gens, pallets and breakable doors too, but don't go too crazy with breaking doors as those can sometimes be used in your favour to trap a survivor. There are quite a few killers to choose from all with their own unique abilities, my favourites lean towards the stealth killers such as Pig, Ghost Face and Myers, but killers like Legion, Toxic Bubba and Spirit can be really fun to play as at times. It depends on your play style :) The game can get really frustrating at times while playing as killer so be sure to take breaks if you get stressed easily, as any survivor who can loop really well can get you in a bind if you're new to the game (and hell even after 177 hours I still sometimes have trouble breaking loops as killer.) Survivors will bring toolboxes to gen rush, they will bring medkits to heal themselves and each other, they will bring keys to escape through hatch when it spawns, they will bring flashlights that will piss you off so much, but remember it is an online game and people are competitive so if you're playing casually brush off games you get with those kinds of players and just keep having fun. Oh and don't be a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ and camp. If you're camping you are actually asking to get your ass handed to you lmao.

It is a solid game but it does have its problems though I still recommend it. Play it with friends (again unless if you're a masochist) and have some fun. There are definitely better games out there, but this is a good one, though the addiction of trying to get over the frustration it can cause is real haha.

Finishing this off, Daddy Blight mains, I love you, Blight scares the crap out of me, but feel free to step on me hard any day ;3 <3
If you want to have fun dont get this game its a decent game but the community is just toxic
